intro: Agalmyla bracteata, commonly known as the bracted agalmyla, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while the stems are often covered in fine hairs. Agalmyla bracteata is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
